name: df-haus
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cha, crab(s0, ctop, wral(s1, cuni(cv(s0)), wral(s2, cuni(cv(s0)), wi(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wrex(s3, cv(s0), wrex(s4, cv(s0), w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s3)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s4)), wceq(cin(cv(s3), cv(s4)), emptycls)))))))))
comment: Define the class of all Hausdorff (or T_2) spaces. A Hausdorff space is a topology in which distinct points have disjoint open neighborhoods. Definition of Hausdorff space in [Munkres] p. 98. (Contributed by NM, 8-Mar-2007.)
